newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: DB says Warriors' performance a concern.
newsitem.headline: DB says Warriors' performance a concern.

text.p: DB Group Ltd, primary sponsor of the Auckland Warriors rugby league team, said on Wednesday the poor performance of the team this season was a concern.
DB was reviewing its sponsorship obligations but the brewer remained committed to seeing out the rest of the contract.
The Warriors have performed badly so far this season and are currently at the bottom of the Telstra Cup rugby league table.
The Warriors had benefitted the DB Bitter brand in its initial two years but that was no longer the case in the third, chief executive Erik Korthals Altes told a news conference.
DB's contract with the Warriors has two years to run "and we will be loyal to that to the bitter end.
"That doesn't say that if the Warriors are privatised that we may have discussions with the new owner ... whether he was interested in naming rights," he said.
Korthals Altes said big sponsorship by breweries was becoming a thing of the past "when it was a matter of them or us and the price would ratchet up to very high levels.
"We are reviewing all these kinds of commitments and relating them back to the real volumes that you are talking about," he said.
Sponsorship had in the past been important because of a ban on television liquor advertising, which has since been lifted.

"If you look at sponsorships in a marketing sense, a sponsorship is definitely something to increase brand awareness, but now we have so many other, and maybe better, means to do that, we have to re-evaluate sponsorships in that mix.
"It was very dominant and it will be much less dominant in the future as we re-negotiate," he said.
